title: Introducing python-in-browser
body:
Python-in-browser is a project I have been working on which allows you to run Python code in your browser, sandboxed away from your system. 
I was inspired by https://github.com/raxod502/python-in-a-box, but python-in-browser has very few things in common. 
Python-in-a-box runs Python code on a server, so it has access to most of the good Python featues.
Python-in-browser parses Python code in your browser, so it lacks most of those features. 
The only good thing about Python-in-browser is the fact that it sends no requests to a server, so it works offline. (to some degree, and the page must be loaded with an internet connection)
